result.execSummary:
The defendant Gabriel Banda Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid within 60 days.  Cash bond to be applied. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Contact between the defendant and the victims be at the discretion of the agent.

Attend and complete the Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program. 
Attend and complete parenting classes.

timeConds.notes:
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gabriel Banda in court with attorney John H. Wallace. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Interpreter Karyn Simmons is present. 
Both cases heard: 14CM185, 14CF412
11:19 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  14CF412 Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CF412 Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

State has complied with Victim Witness Notification.
Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
24 months probation
90 days jail
7 days credit
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date.
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid within 60 days.  Cash bond to be applied.
Contact between the defendant and the victims be at the discretion of the agent. 
Attend and complete the DAAP and 
Attend and complete parenting classes.  

BY THE COURT:  Count 2 is dismissed and read-in.  14CM185 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Wallace will review post conviction with the defendant.
Plea hearing at 10-05-2015 11:00 am

8:44 a.m. Defendant Gabriel Banda in court with attorney John H. Wallace. Interpreter Soria given the Oath of Interpreter. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Wallace request matter to be rescheduled. BTC: granted. Bond is continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Plea hearing at 09-10-2015 08:30 am (Interpreter Soria will be present on 09-10-15)
Interpreter confirmation.
Plea hearing at 08-05-2015 09:00 am  - (Interpreter E. Soria will be present on Aug 5, 2015 hearing)
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn
Pre-trial conference on June 1, 2015 at 10:30 am. (Interpreter E. Soria will be present on June 1, 2015 hearing)
Pre-trial conference on March 23, 2015 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Gabriel Banda Jr.
Current: 1444 Maple St, Almond, WI 54909 United States  (Effective: 01-12-2015)
Prior: 1286 Portage St. #3, Almond, WI 54909
Defendant Record Update
and Request for Documents and Motion for Discovery
Pre-trial conference on January 12, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Gabriel Banda in court with attorney John H. Wallace. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:03 p.m. Court calls the case. 
Court swears in Interpreter Enrique Soria. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 12, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 24, 2014 at 03:00 pm. (Enrique Soria will be present to interpret on Nov. 24)
Preliminary hearing on November 17, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Gabriel Banda in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Interpreter Enrique Soria appears in court and is sworn by the Clerk. 

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Defendant indicates he has an attorney thru the public defenders office, Atty Ryan Drengler. 
Court asks the bailiff to see if Atty Drengler is in the hall, he is not. 
Court questions defendant further. 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

ADA  Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.
Interpreter Soria appears next to Defendant from jail by video.

1:25 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

1:26 PM Interpreter is given the Oath of Interpreter.

Atty Cousins states that a complaint has been prepared and will be filed this afternoon.
ADA Cousins  states facts for anticipated charges of Physical Abuse of a Child, Intentional Harm and Bailjumping.
Court advises Defendant's right to remain silent.
Defendant addresses the Court regarding the facts.  Defendant did not cause any of the injuries, was driving and told them to be quiet.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 

State requests a $2,500 cash  with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:   November 10, 2014 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  *Sandra Banda, Y.B. (11-3-00), L.B. (8-25-02), B.B. (8-16-98), D.B.  (9-3-04), and A.B. (10-13-08). No contact with  the residence at 1286 Portage Street, Almond WI.
Bail/bond hearing on October 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

ADA Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

1:20 PM Court calls case.
Defendant needs an interpreter.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Child Abuse as a Felony - Intentionally Caused.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court will continue the appearance to tomorrow at 1:30 PM

An Interpreter needs to be made available.
